page.title: 12Norton Green
page.content: Norton Green is a small village with a green where children can play.There is is one pub and not many shops.There are a number of old stone houses,one was Norton workhouse during the late 18th. century.There are some 19th. century terraced houses built for the miners and workers at the then iron foundry. A small estate of council houses was built about 30 years ago and new houses are under construction in Foundry Square.The River Trent runs through the village. The school which closed in 1983 after 104 years was called Trentside. An arm of the Caldon Canal was made into Norton Green and an iron foundry supplied the iron work for the Menai Suspension Bridge,completed in 1826. The foundry and mines no longer exist.
